meanings.definition: The state of being in old age and telling anecdotes.
meanings.sent1: In his anecdotage, Grandpa loved sharing stories from his youth.
meanings.sent2: Her anecdotage brought laughter and warmth to family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: During his anecdotage, he often repeated the same funny tales.
meanings.sent4: The anecdotage of the elderly couple was a treasure trove of memories.
meanings.sent5: The room filled with joy as she entered her anecdotage with grace.

meanings.definition: The tendency to tell anecdotes, especially in old age.
meanings.sent1: His anecdotage made him a beloved storyteller among friends.
meanings.sent2: As she entered anecdotage, her stories became more colorful and vivid.
meanings.sent3: The anecdotage of the retiree always brought smiles to those around.
meanings.sent4: In her anecdotage, she wove tales that captivated listeners young and old.
meanings.sent5: The anecdotage of the wise man was a fountain of wisdom and humor.
